channel.title: How to hide the "Active link"
channel.description:
hay i would like to know how to hide the active link on a website so when i hover over the link it dose not show in the bottom left hand corner were it goes.
also frames i seen on a site
[code] </head> <frameset rows="*,0" frameborder="no" border="0" framespacing="0"> <frame name="mainframe" src="/index.php?frameset=1" frameborder="0" scrolling="yes" noresize> <frame name="trk" src="http://analytics.gameforge.de/cp.php?game=ogame&action=visit&gr=&lang=org&kid=" frameborder="0" noresize> </frameset> </html> [/code]
if i follow the link i just get =<15 random letters or numbers i would think this is because its php correct but the html layout should show how are they doing this if i use the webdev add-on in FF then i can see it?

item.title: How to hide the "Active link"
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I’ve done something similar in PHP. It links you to a randomly generated page (with a random filename), which redirects you to another site.

Read full topic

hay i would like to know how to hide the active link on a website so when i hover over the link it dose not show in the bottom left hand corner were it goes.

	</head>
